section.name: System
section.description: These are configurable system settings. Change them only if you know what you are doing!

setting.name: Debugging
setting.description: If set to true, reporting will be verbose and all events will be recorded to the log file for the purpose of debugging errors.

setting.name: User Name
setting.description: The name of the person using this system.

setting.name: User Identification
setting.description: The identification tag of the person using this system.

setting.name: Interface Language ID Code
setting.description: The language ID code that sets the language to be used in the user interface.

setting.name: Log File Length
setting.description: This is the maximum number of lines that will be permited to be in the log file. This is necessary because Rapuma records all events in one log file.

setting.name: System Initialization Date
setting.description: Time stamp of when the system was installed.

setting.name: Auto-Create Helper Scripts
setting.description: Automatically create auto-helper scripts on project creation.

setting.name: SVG to PDF Converter Command
setting.description: The command needed to convert a SVG file to PDF. Mostly used for creating backgound watermark files. Input and output filenames are represented by these key terms: svgInFile and pdfOutFile. Use those along with any other application-specific commands. The default setting is for the rsvg-convert utility.

setting.name: Text Differential Viewer Command
setting.description: The command needed to view a comparison between the current working file and its source.

setting.name: PDF Viewer Command
setting.description: The default command needed to view PDF documents produced by the system. This can be changed at the component manager level.

setting.name: PDF Utility Command
setting.description: The default command needed to operate the PDF manipulation utility. Note that currently Rapuma only supports pdftk.

setting.name: Recognized Component Types
setting.description: A list of valid component types that are recognized by the Rapuma system.

setting.name: Maximum Stored Backups
setting.description: The maximum number of backups that can be stored in the project backup folder.

section.name: Resources
section.description: This section contains the location of addition resources the user may wish to access. Note resources in these specified locations will override any in the system of the same name.

setting.name: Default Projects Path
setting.description: The full path to where projects are kept. The default is set for deployment on a Debian server. Adjust for other environments.

setting.name: Rapuma Resource Path
setting.description: The full path to where Rapuma resources like fonts, backups, etc. are kept. They can go any where but if it is not specified, Rapuma will look under Publishing first.

setting.name: Font Collection Path
setting.description: The full path to where fonts are kept on this system that the user would like to access. Note that there must be a valid XML description file for each font family.

setting.name: Illustration Collection Path
setting.description: The full path to where illustrations are kept on this system that the user would like to access. Note that there must be a valid XML description file for each illustration collection.

setting.name: Custom Macro Collection Path
setting.description: The full path to where macros are kept on this system that the user would like to access.

setting.name: Custom Script Collection Path
setting.description: The full path to where scripts are kept on this system that the user would like to access.

setting.name: Archived Projects Path
setting.description: The full path to where archives are kept on this system that the user will need access.

setting.name: Backup Projects Path
setting.description: The full path to where backups are kept on this system that the user will need access.

setting.name: Project Template Path
setting.description: The full path to where templates are kept on this system that the user will need access.

setting.name: Project Cloud Path
setting.description: The full path to where cloud backups are kept on this system that the user will need access.

setting.name: Default Illustrations Library Name
setting.description: The name of the illustrations collection library that is most commonly used. This will go into all new projects but can be easily changed at the project level.
